I used to live across the street and visit all the time, but I won't be returning again.
author: James D.

description: Tasty spot, usually very busy, but staff work incredibly hard to get food out quickly! Good location in a busy spot of town. Would highly recommend for a burrito
author: Jack O.

description:
I came in here for lunch on a Sunday with three friends and a restaurant.com coupon. I always expect places in the Mission to be kind of grimy--though don't get me wrong, it's my favorite district when it comes to eating in SF--and was pleasantly surprised when I observed the cleanliness of El Toro Taqueria. Even the counter on which they assemble food, where there is usually a lot of spilled food, was spotless. I rattled off a long list of orders and the servers were extremely detail-oriented, asking me multiple times what level spiciness I wanted for the salsas on various dishes. 

I got a prawn taco, which had a generous serving of shrimp. I happily doused it with lime, but did not really use the ranch sauce that came with it. Two of my friends got quesadillas, which looked very good and also came with chips. We made sure to taste each offering from the salsa bar. Midway through our meal a Mexican man with a guitar popped in and started strumming away, and then came around to all the diners to ask for tips. I'm not sure if he was even affiliated with the restaurant...anyways, I would definitely come to eat again! El Toro impresses with their food and especially with their tidiness.
author: Amy G.

description: I never got a chance to go back since my last review, but since our gripe was with the service and not the food, it seemed only fair to add an additional star because the owner contacted me personally and apologized for the mix-up and asked for another chance.
author: Richard A.

description: My family came from out of town to visit Mission Dolores,.....we left all 8 of us were starving......suggested we go to 'EL TORO"....... we all had different items, all delicious,fast...was crowded sat at 4 different tables,family didn't mind....they even brought the food to us!!...very friendly staff......food was not expensive.....they give you a lot for your money......we defintely will be back!!!
author: Robert F.

description: Delicious inexpensive tacos in the Mission. Recommended by a local friend and didn't disappoint.
author: Andrea S.

description:
A standard of the Mission Burrito scene.  El Toro has been around for a long time, and have awesome burritos and tacos.  The rest of the menu can be really hit and miss.  I was disappointed to come in and see a sign on the counter talking about their 'taco happy hour' which the staff promptly explained are "Tacos as small as they can make" not their "Regular Tacos".  Ok I'll pass then.  So I tried some enchiladas for the first time and they were pretty "Meh".  Overcooked and blasting hot by the microwave they were put in before being served to me.  Lesson learned I'll stick with the burritos!
Drinks are soda or bottled beers, no margaritas, and even though it's right across from the police station there's almost daily crazy homeless doing something that makes you stare and say "No Way!".  Watch your parking around here after dark.....All the glass on the sidewalks should tell you why.
Will I be back.....Hell yeah cuz Burritos/Booze/and Bumfights rock!
author: Jim P.

description: I work in the neighborhood and frequently have lunch at El Toro.  The food is consistently good. Today, something weird happened.  I ordered three for the taco happy hour ($1.50 each) and the cashier rang me up at $4.76 and then she cleared the register total, and then re-rang me up for "Waiter - Deliveries" for $7.61.  When I pointed this out she said, "no, three for $7."  Say what?  This just seems super shady to me. It's not the $2 and change I was overcharged, it's the way she went about it.  Think I'll stick to go there when it's not "happy hour" and I am correctly charged for my order.
author: S W.

description: I ordered a number of things via Caviar.  The food came quickly, but it was cold and bland.  The guacamole was gross.  I won't order from them again.
author: Niki Y.

description:
My favorite taqueria in The City. Good service, and great, authentic food. 
All meat choices are good, and the beans are just about unbeatable. 
The "Super" is totally worth it. It may seem thin, but it's about the size of 2 regular burritos. So filling.
Also, the burritos are always made well. I've never had a rip or leak or smear on the side. Just how a burrito should be made.
Solid 4 stars.
author: Haley D.

description:
El Toro is another burrito producing line of awesome.  Fun fact it is also owned by Pancho Vila ( which is on 16th street). 

In comparison El Toro burritos are bigger but shorter. My experience was annoying as the lady refused and argued with me because I purchased and wanted to use the yelp deal. 

Unless the terms of service upon purchase of this coupon states their ability to deny whenever.  I shouldn't have to deal with this waste of time and insult.  

Food quality was good.  Same price as most burritos in the mission.
author: Nathan A.

description:
Nothing special but mission burritos in... well the mission are all satisfying in the same cylindrical vessel of warm and gooey beans and meat that works 60% of the time every time.

What I'm trying to say is El Toro is one of many but it's hard to go wrong in the Mission and this joint is no exception.
author: Misha T.

description:
While wandering around playing tourist someone recommended this place.    It is on point and genuine.    I ordered a baby burrito and it was more than enough food.

Not a ton of seating and was fully busy the entire time we were there on a week day.   

Lots of different salsa choices and the nachos were piled high and amazing.     

This place may not look like anything special but trust me it is :)
author: Heather F.

description: Easily the worst burrito I've ever had. Absolutely no flavor. Overcooked shrimp and brown guacamole. Won't be back.
author: Shelaya L.

description: Ordered carne asada on UberEATS, paid extra for green salsa. Also paid extra for it in a burrito. The food came, without the salsa in both dishes. Usually this would be annoying but not a huge deal in the whole scheme of things, but it was extremely so because the meat was not seasoned at all and bland and we had to eat it with no salsa. I gave it two stars because the rest of the food was fine but not a great eating experience because the carne was flavorless and they forgot our salsa (in 2 different dishes) which we paid EXTRA for.
author: Emmy-Maria J.

description: In my top 5 mexican restaurants in SF!! Love their food and drinks, never had any complaints about this place.  Top notch quality food and friendly staff!!!
author: RJ J.

description:
Fresh, fast and flavorful.  Came here looking for a good basic burrito.  Got a carnitas and it totally fit the bill.  For 7 bucks it's an unbeatable deal.  A very clean and efficient place.  A lady even told me not to bother with clearing my table as I was about to.  They do it.  Wow, it's like a real restaurant!  :)  I know other burrito places like Farolito, Pancho, Cancun seem to get more traffic, but honestly they're overhyped and often too chaotic and not as clean (just compare the health scores!  El Toro is 100, the others are not).  I'll definitely be going back here.  Check out the cool painted bulls on the wall while you eat.

PS -- I appreciate how the owner clearly cares about customer satisfaction judging by follow-ups he's posted here.
author: J K.

description: Did you know you can get three tacos for $7.00?  That's the deal!  Comes with a small complimentary chips.  This reminds me of a Mexican subway.  You get asked what you want to put in your taco.  Everything is fresh.  They have heat for these cold days and nights. They have a well stocked condiment bar (all you want salsa!).  It's always nice place to stop and eat a little.
author: Helen L.

description: So I've been coming here for years. With my old man as a kid and a few times as an adult. The food is good but I have always had an issue with the people that work there. If I don't order in Spanish, the person behind the counter, cops attitude,  plays dumb, and points out an item that's completely different than what I asked for. After 30 years nothing has changed. They don't wipe the tables, or clean the floors, and it takes 10000 years to get anything from them. Because of that fact I started frequenting La Cumbre and Pancho Villa down the block on 16th. This recent time I stopped by there while at a funeral. Even after all these years, Its the same old story. You would think gentrification would make them step it up a bit. With so many better choices for Mexican foor in the area, it's a wonder they're still open.
author: Dirk D.

description: The super vegetarian burrito was great! The lady making the burrito was very nice and accommodated my imperfect Spanish skills. There was no wait at 3:00 pm on a weekday. The free chips were great and they have an unlimited salsa bar! Try the salsa verde!
author: Vihan J.

description: A burrito is a must-eat for me in San Francisco.  On my most recent visit, my favorite Mission burrito spot, Pancho Villa, was closed, so I was forced to try a new place.  I had no idea that El Toro Taqueria and Pancho Villa have the same owners.  I had my usual burrito:  a vegetarian burrito with mostly rice, black beans, cheese, and hot sauce. The burrito seemed smaller than Pancho Villa's and the rice was slightly dry, but the burrito was still good and hit the spot.  Like Pancho Villa, El Toro has a salsa bar, which is great.  The chipotle salsa is my favorite. Someday, I'll have to do a taste off between the two places.
author: Lindy S.

description:
Great prices for large portions of fresh well seasoned options. We were there last week and the dinner size options are generous. Staff is friendly and while the seating is limited, the customers seemed relaxed in the smallish space.

Update: for Gary E.: we had the Taco Dinner plate and the Carnitas dinner plate. Both very good.
author: CS W.

description: Food is good, and the folks working there are super nice.  While some of the folks who work behind the counter may not speak fluent English but they always get my orders right.  Always have smiles on their faces.  I have been coming here quite a few times esp when I use my restaurant.com certificate.  Great deal for good food.  Love their free salsa bar.  Lady was so nice to give me extra chips cause I bought 10 burritos.  Thank you!
author: Susan K.

description:
Some of the greasiest al pastor I've ever had in my life! 
But it was still pretty bueno.. 

Anyway.

This place is all healthy n $h1t. Decent, open late, accepts GoPago.
author: Susy C.

description:
We had burritos @ this place, because it was rated high on yelp. We really enjoyed them until the last bite, a large roach crawled up from under the table, we kept our cool and just left and walked out.

I will pass it on the my friends DO NOT GO TO THIS PLACE!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Kevin K.

description: I ordered a chicken & prawn salad. The salad only consists of lettuce and tomatoes (and the meat). It doesn't come with avocado or cucumbers as most salads do. Anyhow the portion was small so I ask for a little more lettuce. The employee mentioned it was an extra charge...for lettuce? I was confused. Will never ever return here bad service. I don't know how they operate this business.
author: Princess Jasmine J.

description:
We had our first ever burrito here when visiting San Francisco and it was amazing. Seriously. I didn't know what I had been missing out on, and I guess it means that I also have nothing to compare it to, but it was delicious, very filling and obviously good quality food. 

Neither of us like beans, so we can't vouch for those, but I had the slow cooked pork and my husband had the chicken - they were both superb. I would definitely get the pork again. 

The staff were really smiley, and happy - they clearly found it amusing that we'd obviously never ordered a burrito before and they were helpful. 

The free chips that came with it were a bonus, and we enjoyed the sauce bar. 

I'd visit again.
author: Lindsey B.

description: Someone ahead of me in line had well done shrimp sizzling on the grill for their dish, so I was inspired to get a shrimp burrito -- as I was waiting, the line grew and I guess they got stressed?...so they rushed and now I'm at home with a burrito that has barely cooked shrimp and I am extremely frustrated. Not to mention that everything else in here is wet and nondescript. Damn it Mission, you let me down.
author: Amanda B.

description: One of the best seafood burritos I've ever had and the price is great. Reminds me of San Diego and the service was FAST! There was also alot of space to sit but it was packed every time I've came here. The Red Snapper was really good and fresh and huge portions!
author: Vincent G.

description: Delivery sucked, it took an hour to deliver 3 tacos. 3 cold tacos. And i ordered cheese on my tacos and they decided to throw it all on one taco. The guy walked in and the box in the bag was sideways, so my tacos were basically dumped out.
author: Courtney H.

description: I was here years ago on a recommendation from a colleague, what a great place! Carne asada was delicious, it was a great lunch.  Fast and filling and cheap and delicious.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
It's good, definitely better than anything we have in Boston.  I had a carne asada burrito.  It was good.  But I like some of the other mexican places in the Mission more.

Can't go wrong here.
author: Will C.

description: The food has very good portions and is on par with any of the taquerias in the Mission. The garlic shrimp did not have quite that garlic shrimp taste so that could have been better. The carne asada was very filling. Sides are also good, the rice was not dry and full of flavour.
author: Joseph B.

description:
I really liked this place! It's cleaner than a lot of the other taquerias in the area, so you feel comfortable sitting inside the restaurant and eating here. I had the shrimp seafood dinner ($10), which came with rice, beans, avocado salad & tortillas. Everything was arranged very neatly, everything was delicious, and it was definitely more food than I could finish. Would come here again!

Plus, they have a deal on restaurant.com, which makes it cheaper than it already is!
author: Cynthia W.

description: I have come here for lunch on many occasions. The restaurant is always clean, food is hot and fresh and the staff are friendly. I most recently ordered the super steak and prawn quesadilla. It was delicious! Tons of fresh, well seasoned, whole jumbo prawns inside (they don't take 2-3 prawns and cut them into a million pieces like other restaurants do).
author: Andreea M.

description:
I've always loved this place.  They have a great selection of meats.  The thing I appreciate most is that they have 2 sauced chicken options rather than only having grilled meats for burritos.  Chile verde chicken is my favorite... it's so juicy and tasty!  I'm also a fan of their carnitas.  I've eaten at the restaurant a bunch of times and have always found it clean and friendly.  It's not a huge place, but I've always been able to find seating and I've never run into a super long line.  Recently I've placed a few delivery orders as well.

The only reason I'm giving 4 our of 5 stars is that the delivery hours to my neighborhood are very limited and, the last couple times I ordered delivery, the chile verde chicken enchiladas had red sauce, though I specified green.
author: Kelly W.

description: Good food, good price. Less busy than sister location Pancho Villa. Seating not very comfy.
author: Andrew A.

description: Best place to get a burrito since its cheap. For a super burrito, it's $8.50 plus food tax which is close to $9 for a burrito. It's a huge burrito also. If you check in on yelp, you will get an offer for $2 off on any super burrito.
author: Nick F.

description: Awesome customer service, great authentic fresh Mexican food. The employees make you feel at home:) definitely a good fresh place to remember. (Restroom needs updating)
author: Ulises A.

description:
Simply the classic, awesome SF Taqueria. Everything is outstanding! Meats are perfect. Beans are spiced perfectly. Chips are great. Salsa is wonderful. Any burrito mood you are in, this place will satisy. Used ot eat here 3X a week without any dissapointment. Pancho Villa on 16th is the same place too. Do not even think of wasting your time on La Cumbre just on Valencia.

taken from my review elsewhere
author: Anthony S.

description:
One of the many no-frills taquerias in this neighborhood that you can always depend on to provide you with hearty, stick to your bones sustenance at a great value. I had a carne asada burrito and it was ENORMOUS... I think three people could have easily shared that thing. The chips were fresh and delish, there were lots of salsa options, and they offer lots of options for the non-burrito lover, if there is one out there: tortas, tacos, nachos, and lots of seafood and vegetarian options. 

The ambiance isn't much to speak and the burrito mechanics behind the counter don't really have the time or desire to chitchat, but there are plenty of seats if you choose to eat in and there's rarely a very long line... and they work FAST!

What more could you ask for? A yummy burrito with maybe some cold aguafresca on a warm day at the park... get ready for a perfect day in the Mission!
author: Christina P.

description: Decided to give this place a shot after hearing so many good things about it and got a Carne Asada Burrito and while it was tasty, it was very cold...I went there around 7 PM and I was a bit disappointed on my food, some of the people there were rude too and I'm not sure if I'm ever coming back here
author: Derek M.

description: Good food although the staff was a little arrogant, as if I'm some sort of suppository for their frustrations. It would serve them well in the future to be a lil' chipper about making food for hungry people.
author: Stanley P.

description:
I wanted to use the "check in" offer, but apparently it's not really an offer. It's just a deal you can only get during happy hour. But that deal is available regardless of the yelp offer.

The service was super slow. But the people were friendly enough. 

We had the pastor burrito which was very good and the garlic shrimp which was not up to my standards.

Overall, I'm just not impressed by this place. I think you can find better places nearby.
author: Elizabeth V.

description: Don't order through DoorDash, they screwed up my order twice in a row. Never making that mistake again. Gave them a second chance and the 2nd time was worse than the first. Maybe this is a doordash issue, I'm not entirely sure, but it's a bad look for both companies, as they both lost my business.
author: Chip B.

description: Well, I never thought I'd join Yelp, and I'm sure this review won't make it to the top. But after many, many years of going to El Toro, I'm moving on. The last three times that I've been there they've had numerous online orders that they process even though there is a long line of customers waiting. Tonight I waited 10 minutes and the line didn't move at all even thought the staff were all working hard at getting orders completed. They either need to find a way of dealing with in-person customers, or give up the online orders. I would have given it one star, but the food is actually pretty good. But the lines are horrible. If you must go there, obviously it pays to order online while those of who just pop in wait forever. I finally left and came home and cooked. I've forgotten how nice it is to cook for oneself.
author: Jarl L.

description: I ordered a carne asada burrito here and it wasn't great. I believe it is the same owners here as Pancho Villa, but it was definitely not as good. The chips were not great either. Half my burrito was cold and it was mediocre. I recommend walking a couple more blocks to Pancho Villa. With all the great taquerias in the Mission, I don't need to go here again.
author: Lauren G.

description:
If you know its neighbor Pancho Villa, then you know El Toro.  I'm not sure if they have the same owner, but these places are nearly identical.  This is a good tip especially if Pancho is getting slammed. 

My favorites are the mini burritos, quesadillas, and anything with prawns.  My husband tried the dinner platter #2.  It had tamales and shrimp.  It was really good and a better bargain than my quesadilla combo.

This place is simple, quick, and inexpensive.
author: Alexis B.

description:
The carnita quesadilla was only ok.  The meat was a little lacking in flavor.

The tacos are delicious, though!  In large part because it is stuffed to the brim with meat, beans, and pico de gallo, and I have a soft spot for corn tortillas.

The bbq pork has much better flavor and texture (more fat!) than the carnita, and the chicken fajita also has good flavor, and includes green peppers and onions.  I would recommend these meats over the carnita meat.

I appreciated the variety in their salsa bar, and the ones I tasted were pretty good.  I also enjoyed the spicy pico de gallo they added on my tacos.

It was all reasonably priced, too.
author: Tim C.

description: Me and several of my work partners ordered El Toro the other day. Delicious! The flavor,ingredients all come together perfectly. And I got extra meat and it made for a perfect Burrito. Don't be put off by the long line-it moves. And its obvious that the burrito is being put together by someone who knows how to make a good burrito. Looking forward to trying more on the menu.
author: Jimmy L.

description:
I thought this place was alright - typical Mission taqueria...

I had the Carnitas Dinner Plate, which included a nice portion of savory, tender pork with rice, beans and small salad.  The food was good, although nothing spectacular to make it stand out from the crowd in Mission-area taquerias.  I also had an Agua Fresca (Strawberry), which was really good, refreshing and sweet.  They have a huge menu and I like that there really is something for everyone.
author: Ken G.

description: Was working late and ordered delivery. They came in decent time however was shorted the sour cream I had paid for. That wouldn't have been a one star rating by itself, but the fact that the tamales were dry and tasteless made the lack of sour cream or any salsa with the meal made it crap. I threw 90% of it out.
author: Nick G.

description:
The Carne Asada Burrito is for real.

I mean, the average burrito is $8.00ish dollars, which works out to like 112 pesos. Shut up about the cost already. The food is good and it lacks that "this place is so dirty that I may or may not get e.coli from this burrito" feeling. Which is awesome.
author: Tara H.

description: Mother and I ordered from here after a busy day of running errands cause it was the closet place. First off the lady who served us had a bad attitude and couldnt hear me correctly after I'd told her my order more than twice. Secondly, my mom and I both ordered four tacos in which the lady BARELY put any ingredients on it, it was if she was counting them. She put like three pieces of lettuce on my mothers tacos in which she was charged 35 cents PER taco for it. Third, the tortillas did not taste good, it was hell trying to keep them down. One star because the lady on the register was very nice. Nonetheless, my mom and I will not be coming back.
author: Andrea G.

description:
When we visited SF last week, we found this great place on restaurant.com

I'm glad we checked it out... It hit all the good spots.. Clean, hot food, tasty, and affordable.

We tried a couple burritos, nachos, plenty of salsas and hot chips....

Everything was tasty...

I would go back even without the restaurant.com gift certificate....
author: Joe B.

description: Love their food especially the big delicious burritos. They have a huge variety of choices to make your own burritos or tacos or quesadillas. It is one of my favorite spots that I just happen to walk in one day and I'm glad I did. The whole family loves this place.
author: Carlos M.

description:
El Toro Tacqueria is one of the better burrito joints in the Mission. They have nice service, give very generous portions, and  their beans and rice are very good (really important building blocks of a good burrito).

Where I think they fall a little bit short is in the meat department. The grilled chicken has good flavor and is cooked well, but I would have like to see it chopped up a bit more like they do with their carne asada. The spicy chicken also suffered from the huge chunks problem, but it's really not spicy at all. It's more like a chicken in a flavorful orange sauce. The carne asada is cooked well, but it's way too smoky for my tastes. I love me some smoke, but not when it is the most dominant flavor.

Their salsa bar though, is a big plus, as you can serve yourself and they have a very good selection of salsas. They have a tomatillo verde, pico de gallo, red salsa, and at least 5 other kinds that I can only remember by vague description (e.g. an orange one, and a roasted red one). I've tried them all, and they are all very good. You're likely to find one that suits your taste (I personally love mixing them!)

For a good burrito joint with great prices, El Toro is a good option, but perhaps not the best in the Mission.
author: Jeffrey J.

description:
When one is forced to spend $40 between two people at a taqueria, one is forced to come up with a plan of eattack (cwidt?). One also realizes that though that sounds like a lot of money, it is still San Francisco after all, and that $40 doesn't actually buy you as much as you think it would. :/

When my friend told me he had a coupon for El Toro, but that we'd need to spend $40 to redeem it, I said "challenge accepted." Dreams of rivers of guacamole and flans falling out of the sky ensued. When we got there, we realized that oh, that's only $20 a person, which means a huge combo plate, a beer, and a flan each. And some guac to share, for good measure.

The food. It was really tasty! I got shrimp and taquitos and tomales with a side of rice and beans and salad. That sounds like a lot of food because it WAS. Loved the taquitos. My favorite part of the meal, though, was the flan. Great texture, not too sweet. Just how I like it.

Can't wait to come back and have their burritos!
author: jon y.

description:
Was up in the Bay for a trip and told this place was the spot for Mexican food. I joked that I'm from LA and so my bar is pretty high but was told to fear not, this place would blow me away.

The only thing that blew me away was the price I paid for a subpar burrito. I've only been once, but I can tell you their al pastor was not anything to write home about or in this case, give above two stars on Yelp.
author: Patrick F.

description: i ordered my dad's father's day dinner online through the app called order ahead..  i requested my order be ready for pick up at 7:30 because i was getting off work  to go visit my dad for father's day... i get there one plate out of 5 were done... my onions were burnt..  and cold the other 4 which were done fresh were done ok... no one apologized for my order done wrong and ad no one wanted to right the cold food i got having been there for over 30 sitting on the rack....
author: Norma G.

description: Best carnitas and chicken burrito bowls and salsa bar.  Best salsa verde in SF.  They also give you chips without charging you anything extra...like the greedy taqueria's do.  Best lunch or quick dinner spot.
author: Michelle H.

description:
Here's a tip:  if you use restaurant [dot] com, don't get a fifty dollar gift certificate to this place.  Not that the food is poor (the food is fine).  Not that the service is crap (service was great).  It's just, well, if you're dining with less than six people, GOOD LUCK USING THE WHOLE THING.

We were in the city for festivities and I was under the impression that we were going to have a party of ten.  First mistake, really.  Then, upon arrival with only four people, I learned quickly that they may have had trouble seating a party of ten anyway.

Next came the order.  In an attempt to use all of the certificate, everyone at the table ordered two entrees (I can't remember the name but they were the 'every meat we have grilled and chucked on a plate' specials) and we still had thirty bucks to use.  "BRING ON THE PACIFICOS" I said.  I'm sure I was having a better time than the lady who was ringing me up, trying to calculate how many brown bottles it would take to satisfy my fifty-dollar obligation.

Anyhow, really good food, patient service.  Location sucks for parking, especially with everything that's around it, but what can you do?
author: Jon M.

description: I used to go to Pancho Villas a lot. I only went to El Toro once or twice in 1994 or so... but it was memorable. I had my first horchata here....   There was a mexican seasoned tofu they offered that was quite delicious... and there was a mariachi band. It was quieter than the other one but the food was quite good and that is the main thing right.
author: Stiobhard D.

description:
I ordered a torta ahogada, and one of the dudes behind the counter laughed and said something unintelligible.  I had a thought that his laughter related to me, but I dismissed my anxiety.  Next time I'll be able to identify the laugh as the "He won't know the difference!" laugh.  I received a sandwich drenched in what could only have been melted Cheez Wiz.   No picante in sight.  In fact, no amount of "hot" salsa dumped over it added any heat.  Rather, the sandwich quickly assumed an amalgamation of the worst qualities of vomit, melted plastic, and hobo piss.

Clearly, someone misheard my order as: "torta ahogringo."
author: Oaktown Dad S.

description:
I used to like this place, but after today I will not be back. I had a grilled vegetable burrito (take-out) and was immediately sick from eating it. Like, broke out in sweats, thought I was going to pass out, die and someone was going to find me on the toilet. It passed, but it was beyond bad.

I called them up later figuring I should report it so that they could remove the questionable ingredients and prevent someone else from suffering the same fate.

Guess what? El Toro doesn't care about you getting sick from their food. When I told them what happened they told me the people working a short time ago were off shift and I should call back tomorrow when they're back again. Really? How does that solve the problem? 

I told them I didn't want anything, I just wanted to make sure no one else got sick. I got no apology and they hung up on me. 

I'd like to think there was some language barrier, but I think I got sick from your food is pretty basic. I hate complaining on the internet, but their lack of empathy was just disturbing.
author: Kiran U.

description:
With carne asada on the brain and a parking place found along Valencia I returned to El Toro, where I'd not been for years.  When I used to come here I was all about the Super Burrito which has everything + the kitchen sink (guacamole, sour cream, etc.).  These days I'm more of a purist, and opted for a simpler Regular Burrito:  Carne Asada, rice, beans, and hot salsa.

El Toro is very quick, clean, and efficient.  Even the excellent serve-yourself salsa bar is immaculate and well stocked.

I think I erred on a few counts though:  

*  Got refried beans in the burrito and felt like I was eating circa 1987.

*  Should've got that Super Burrito as the carne asada was good, not great, and could've used some additional flavor maximizers.  

*  I like the way they stuff your to-go burrito bag with tortilla chips.  Be sure to grab some salt though, as these ones seemingly had none. 

I'll be back here again, to do it right.  Those shrimp and carnitas topped nachos, ordered by the guy in front of me, looked like pure heaven.
author: Tracey A.

description: Love this place! Such good food at good prices. Huge portions. 2 'make it super' tacos are enough for me and nachos are really good also.
author: Amber F.

description:
Have been coming once a month for the last few years now. GF always gets the Super Quesadilla and her attention is always on the steak meat - most recently it was tough.
I've gotten all kinds of tacos , enchiladas, shrimp and fish dishes and they are always delicious. we are so lucky to live close by. No matter how crowded the place is, the service is always awesome and the salsa is always spectacular. Thanks El Toro!
author: Nan L.

description:
I had three chicken taquitos for a little over $5. I skipped the rice and beans and was pleasantly surprised when my taquitos came with not only the typical mexican salad garnish (does anyone ever eat that?) but a scoop of legit guacamole! The best part was this amazing red sauce that they put over everything, it was to die for!!!  Perfect amount of spice and kick, and left me planning my next visit immediately. Great location, happy sunny seats by the window, and friendly staff.

oh and the bathroom was CLEAN!
author: Kassaundra G.

description:
this is a refuge for me when i need real mexican food...no its NOT fine cuisine, sit down (bad) mexican food.  this is as close though to home cooked mexican food as anything ive ever eaten in a taqueria...and im OLD kids, ive been around...ive eaten 100000's of meals.  and ive eaten here for decades!

only TWO places in sf would get this kinda review from me, who have both CONSISTENTLY, over many, many years dealt out incredible food - affordable and delicious.  (la mediterranee-noe st - ill review them soon).

el toro is simply the GO TO place for a fast, informal great meal.  cafeteria-style, but that lets them walk you thru the entire process of preparing you food the way YOU like it.  endless selections, all price ranges and even kids portions..PLUS agua frescas!  PLUS a great salsa bar with everything from sliced radishes (a fave with lime and salt/tequila ({NOT supplied here}), roasted jalapenos, many types of fresh salsas - HIJOLE!

i can put away tons of food but its rare i can finish an entire plate of carnitas or even a super burrito at times.  with chips and a cerveza?  seriously, i ate there at 1:30 today...its 10pm now...im STILL full!

and those darned wandering mariachis at times...lol  some good, some ...? but its upbeat and entertaining always.

you owe it to yourself to eat here.

TRUST me...trust me...trust me...you are now hypnotized, go eat there tomorrow!



(but DONT TRUST jennifer j's review...ignorance is NOT always bliss!  sadly it seems some people can not enjoy anything other than their own countrys bad food - NVER trust someone who eats treacle and spotted dick!)
author: Miguel D.

description:
El Toro is like Pancho Villa's cuter, smarter younger sister. 

Now I can't get the image of Pancho Villa's little sister out of my head. Let's start over.

If you're sick of the lines and the oddballs that hang out near Pancho Villa, but you're still addicted to the angel tears they hide in their tacos, El Toro is your perfect compromise. It's near - but not on - 16th Street, so there's easy access on your way to/from Dolores Park, but not so easy that it's packed. I've only ever waited about a minute in line tops, and that's when they had a full house. The food - however - is exactly what you'd expect from the team behind Pancho Villa. Try their carnitas burrito with their borderline heavenly pico and guac, and you'll be in burrito heaven. Which is really want to believe exists.
author: Kevin B.

description: Refused to honor my yelp check-in deal by claiming I had an especial burrito despite ordering a super burrito.
author: Michia R.

description: Quick and easy. Service is solid. Good on the table within five minutes of walking in. Tastes amazing and is filling. Got the three taco deal and couldn't finish it. Worth visiting.
author: Lincoln E.

description: Love love love this place.  Amazing salsa bar and yummy food.  Such good prices too!!   Win win
author: T R.

description: It's really nice that this place has vegetarian options (and it's across the street from Good Vibes, perfect). If you "super" your burrito it'll cost around $8, and you get chips with it. I got a tofu burrito, and it was actually really good. The tofu was seasoned well and it just had a good flavor. I didn't like the horchata, though. It was really sweet and almost tasted like bubble gum towards the end...? Just kind of strange. I do like the space and the fact that there is lots of seating.
author: Lauren F.

description:
I stopped by with my friend from work for lunch here at El Toro
since is so close to work they have delicious food at very 
reasonable prices.

I had their pollo asado platter so yummmy with their spanish rice 
it comes with free chips and a deluxe salad, They also have a chili 
sauce bar on the side with a great variety if you like hot chili sauces 
( I love it) their pico the gallo is delicious.

I am only giving them 4 stars just because the restroom is so close
to my table and traffic around my seat little tight space without that 
I would give them 5 stars ( seat by the windows :)   )
author: Theresa B.

description:
4 words; BEST SUPER VEGETARIAN BURRITO.

I love my burritos and I have had good and great but their SV burrito game is out of this world. Just had one today, and it's a constant reminder I will never have another super vege like this ever again anywhere else.
author: Dan B.

description:
Bear market.

Hitting new highs: http://online.barrons.com/article/SB50001424052748703931404578594021354344716.html?mod=BOL_twm_mw#articleTabs_article%3D1

Hitting the spot for lunch: Torta featuring a generous portion of chicken, black beans, salsa and lettuce. Quite good. Quite well priced at just $5.

Yet only two stars. Like on my first visit a bottle of butter was ready to go (stopped him just in time) and a French roll replaced bolillo.

So unhealthy and so missing the signature torta bread.

This bull won't be hitting new highs anytime soon.
author: Jason B.

description:
This is what a taqueria should be like, clean, cheap, fast and delish....
All those crappy over priced "Mexican" new joints in town are just plain and fake and very expensive..... A taco should never be more than 1. 50 and a burrito never over 8 bucks..... I don't care what kind of stuff you put in them, it just does not add up to that.... If they charge you more, run!!!!
This place is great with gread salads and dinner specials....
Only one thing, they should add the grill onions to the salad bar, they charged 1.50 for onions that should be free, and are free in Mexico....... It's a small thing, but it should be complementary, I would not eat anywhere else in the city...... I will walk and eat here anytime i want Mexican food.
Of course The Mission has other great places, but on 16 and Valencia, this place is king....
Go there......
Cheap, clean, good and fast service........
PLEASE STOP SUPPORTING ALL THE OVER PRICED "MEXICAN" PLACES IN TOWN.....!!!!!
Go to El Toro....!!!
author: Jose A. P.

description: I had a fantastic chicken caesar salad! They freshly cut an avocado and put the whole thing into my salad! I've also had a burrito here that was just pretty good. Very cheap and quick!
author: Petie P.

description: Amazing and easy Mexican. I had two tacos (fish and rice+beans) for under $4. They were absolutely delicious and outstanding value for money.
author: Larissa S.

description: YUM! My love and I live 2 blocks away and find ourselves here about 2 times a week. The burritos are just incredible and huge, I love getting it wet (mojado), they drizzle it with a yummy tomato/enchilada sauce. I'm still talking about food. The salsa bar is awesome and what a variety! They are always super fast and so friendly. We can't seem to justify getting a burrito anywhere else! I don't think you will either, besides Pancho Villa which seems to be their sister restaurant.
author: Chauanh D.

description: Great mexican food. 'Nuff said.
author: Nick F.

description: I usually like coming here for Mexican food. After yesterday's experience, I don't think I wanna come back for a while. I paid $25 for 2 items and the whole order was £^€ked  up. I asked for black beans with my plate and got whole pinto beans and I also order a super burrito and received a regular. Not to mention, the lady at the register was very rude... I think you guys should hire new help with better customer service.
author: Maria P.

description: Taquitos galore, wonderful fresh selection of all appetizing mexican delights and most under $10. Very clean restuarant for a fast food setting and nice staff as well.
author: Leean O.

description: Great place i love it most come back agin and get my favoite super quesadilla with extra chiken .
author: Luis G.

description: Very frustrating to order food to-go, pay for it with credit, and then not receive a bag and be told I cannot get one without 10 cents for the tax (which I happened not to be carrying on me at the time). It's unclear to me why I wasn't asked, as is typical, especially when ordering to-go.
author: Ceasar B.

description:
This is a city where people are passionate about Mexican food.  My friends and family spend a third of their life talking about tacos and burritos, comparing local spots, and the more in-the-know have moved on to pupusas and won't eat west of Mission.

And then there is this 5'8" Irishman who daydreams about quesadillas.

Seriously, this has to be the red-headed stepchild of Mexican food.  Quesadillas are the jam.  Tons of meat and gooey cheese.  I am waiting for people to tell me they aren't even authentic, but this carnivore could honestly care less, I love quesadillas and order them everywhere I go.

It just so happens that El Toro Taqueria serves a delightful little dish called the "Steak and Prawn" quesadilla, and because there is nothing that says "calm stomach" like the combination of shrimp, red meat, cheese, Pacifico, and hot sun in Dolores Park, I order this practically every weekend.  And where my stomach revolts in horror, my taste buds rejoice in victory, because this is the best damn quesadilla I have had anywhere.
author: James S.

description:
yes, i'm a fan!

cheap tacos. 

huge menu -- maybe too many variety. LOL

clean.

unlimited salsa bar & chips

parking can be a little tough since its on Valencia. 

hubby got super carne asada tacos -- wow. huge meat portions. fresh ingredients. didnt taste dirty or greesy like El Farolito.

i got the salmon taco -- salmon was grilled perfectly. 

would definitely come here again!
author: Carol Y.

description:
I'm an avid fan of Mexican food, so the fact that I come back here all the time is a good sign for this restaurant.  There are 2 big reasons I come here, it's super close to where I live and the orange salsa makes me happy.  I have no idea what is in it but I could drink that stuff assuming that my mouth doesn't catch on fire from whatever pepper they use in it.  The heat level is perfect and it just tastes great.  Who knew a salsa would sway me to going to their restaurant?  

I feel like i've tried a variety of things here and I can say that 3 stars is a good rating for them.  Super tacos and super burritos were a staple for a while.  They aren't the best but when you want some mexican food, it hits the spot.  I don't like that they don't have lengua, which is my favorite taqueria meat.  I love it in tacos, burritos, and just anything.  The one thing I did not like was their taco salad.  I don't know what it was but i was not impressed and decided that I would never get it again, here.  The item I now ALWAYS get is their Super Mushroom Quesadilla.  It has everything I want: tortilla, cheese, sauteed mushrooms, lettuce, tomatoes, spicy salsa, sour cream and guacamole.  It's like the perfect vegetarian meal for me.  

Honestly, I feel like i'm still looking for that one taqueria that has a good taco.  Like the taco truck taco that doesn't include beans in it with pico de gallo.  That seems to be how most if not all the tacos at these Mission taquerias are like.  In the end, I like a few of their things but I have definitely had better Mexican food at different places, particularly in the East Bay.
author: Aaron G.

description: Went in as my boyfriend and I had heard this was owned by the same people from Pancho Villa. I ordered the Carnitas dinner plate to go. The carnitas were overcooked; almost burnt. The guacamole that came with the meal was brown and didn't even look right. This is sub par quality from my regular Pancho Villa experiences. Needless to say, there is a reason there wasn't a line and it was empty on a Thursday night.
author: Lea B.

description: This was a corner taqueria.   Let's just say I wasn't impressed.  You walk along a line where already prepared items sit under lamps.  One selects items and they put them together then one pays at the end.  The place has 2 doors and they both face the front streets.  One can hear and smell what's passing by.  Cashier I thought had an attitude.  Not too friendly for a taqueria.
author: Epi I.

description:
Cantaloupe water is to die for. LOVE IT!!
And the carnita are great to, Lots of meat and almost non fat. just the way I love it.
Enchiladas are great too!!!
author: Fideo T.

description:
This place is one of my favorite  taco places in the Mission.  Although the name is different, El Toro is owned by and has the same menu as Pancho Villa, a block away.

Come here for the happy hour $1 taco specials that run from Monday-Friday 3pm-5pm.  Basically, you choose which meat, beans, and either mild or spicy pico de gallo for your tacos.  

They have one of the best salsa bars and chips around, with fresh pico de gallo, salsa roja, salsa verde,  onions, radishes, carrots, and cilantro for your choosing.  Try their orange sauce, it's delicious! The only negative about this place is that their prices are a bit higher than other taquerias in the Mission.
author: Ryan C.

description:
Wandering through the Mission at lunch time, and having never eaten anywhere in the area before, thought we'd play it safe and go where the crowds were. With the line, nearly out the door. El Toro, it was.

Fast service-nice ladies at the counter. And, YAY, black beans, not cooked with lards for my veggie burrito. Huge portions, very good salsa bar and pretty good guacomole. We chose well. For lunch for the two of us, was under $15.
Win!
author: Jennifer N.

description: The Quesadilla Suiza with Carne Asada and refried beans always hits the spot for me, taking me back to the taquerias I frequented in Northern Mexico. El Toro is an extremely efficient, clean, delicious, women-of-color-operated, slice of Mexican culinary heaven that never disappoints. So happy that it hasn't been taken over by the wave of gentrification that hit Valencia St. many years ago. Try to go for something other than your to-go-to Mexican burrito. There are more things out there, gringos. The tortas and their combo dinners are also super tasty.
author: Erick A.

description: Decent but, nothing special. Once you're inside, it's virtually indistinguishable to any other Mission Taqueria. If it's close, go.
author: Robert M.

description:
This is my all time favorite taqueria! I have been coming here with my family ever since I was little. 

I want to start off by saying that the ingredients are always fresh and the restaurant is always clean. I always order the Super Vegetarian Burrito.   

ALWAYS. 

The fresh ingredients make the burrito. You can see your food being prepared in front of you which is a plus. I can easily control and choose what I want (or don't want) on my burrito. The only thing that makes me feel guilty about this place is the price. It can get expensive, depending on what you order.
author: Dania H.

description: Insignificant quantity and quality  for the price. San Francisco deserves much better than this.
author: Valentin B.

description:
Went for a late lunch with the fam and the super burrito was so scrumptious with the carnitas.  I think as long as a place has good meat, they can't screw up the beans, lettuce, guacamole and other ingredients.  I know this isn't true, but you would think so.  

Anyways going into a food coma around 4:00pm, I pick up some Peet's coffee downtown at the Westfield mall to wake me up.  While heading back to my car and passing the gym up because I am so damn full, I step off the curb and that made me throw up in my mouth a little.   This just reinforced the feeling of the super burrito and how much I enjoyed the hell out of it.   Oh yeh, I got a $10 coupon at www.restaurant.com for $2.  You just have to buy $20 worth of food for them to accept it.
author: James H.

description: 5/14 Shoot- what do I know? But heck- dried carnitas, brown guacamole, flavorless fish taco. 2 stars is generous- if this place is owned by the same people that own pancho villa, they need to pay more attention.  Serious- even the beer is luke warm.  At least the female staff is sweet. Straight up lousy!
author: R G.

description:
I went in here to grab a quick taco because I was starving and this spot filled that empty spot in my stomach, but not much else. 

El Toro was really generic. It didn't have much authentic atmosphere, I sort of felt like I ordered a Safeway select brand taco in comparison to other Mission District taco spots. Granted the food was fresh, there was a good salsa bar and the place was clean. 

I would go here again if I'm across the street and really hungry. I wouldn't go out of my way to go to El Toro, there's other taqueria's in the Mission that have tastier food. 

3 Stars fits this place, A-ok.
author: Maximilian R.

description:
Everytime I walk past this place, it's packed, except during the craziest happy hour special ever, and it's pretty much empty:
3-5, M-F, $1.00 tacos, $2.00 beers! 

The tofu taco is very tasty. The super veggie is scrumptious tambien.
author: Em L.

description: Hmm, I like the food, the only issue was there was way too much salt, I don't know if it was an accident. (Had the mixed plate), they're generous with chips
author: Tiff W.

description: Use to be a nice place to eat when I was a kid, NOW it is full of bland flavor, the meat is terrible, overcooked....
author: Natalie M.

description:
They make a nice burrito. I can only talk about the carnitas, that is all I get. My kid loves her baby burrito. It is under $10 so in my book, it isn't too expensive. This has become our new taqueria since the closing of Azteca - and I'm happy with that , as Azteca was only winning due to proximity to home. 

To the one-star reviewer that complains about others giving this place a decent rating and just mystified by how that could be, here's a primer for you. We enjoyed our food. We had a good experience. We did not become ill.  You, however, were not so fortunate. You did not enjoy your food. You became ill. So you gave it a bad review, and we gave it a good review. There really is no mystery. I hope this has helped clear things up for you.
author: Scott B.

description:
SF Weekly had this as one of the top ten burritos in SF.

I tried the al pastor and found the burrito to have really good construction, with a perfect ratio of ingredients. Al pastor itself, was a bit different than what I'm used to but (more assertive spicing), but I liked it.

Nice salsa bar, free chips.

Will be back to try the other meats.
author: Derrick V.

description: Impressed with the freshness of the food and value here... The servings were huge! Quality and not just quantity too. Definitely a satisfying choice for Mexican among the many good options in the Mission!
author: Amy X.

description:
There are lots of taqueria's in SF, so it's hard to tell one from the other... this place was sliding nicely into a four-star rating after I ordered and tasted their tofu taco.  Yum, that's a real option for me on a mexican menu.  Then I tried the grilled veggie taco sitting right next to it.  Holy heavenly mouthful.  I am now a very happy person in the Mission!!

Go here!
author: Sean S.

description:
On my way to the Cinco de Mayo festivities at Dolores Park, I stopped off at El Toro to pick up a burrito.

I ordered a regular chicken burrito with just rice, beans and chicken.

Rice: mushy and flavorless

Beans: watery and flavorless

Chicken: flavorless

Pouring the watery beans onto the rice created a mushy ball of dough and the only way I could tell chicken was in the burrito was a rubber like texture. 

This burrito cost me $7 - what a ripoff!

The baby burrito at El Farolito is way bigger and a much better bargain not to mention a huge difference in flavor and authenticity. I am very disappointed with my visit to El Toro. There are so many other options to get a decent burrito In the Mission it baffles me how this place stays in business.

I will never step foot in this place again.
author: robert d.

description: First time here had the carne asada burrito which was pretty good. Not greasy at all but had a lot of flavor. Would definitely come back
author: Garry H.

description:
The Al Pastor is just right.
An order of nachos is just about too much for one person!
author: Ken B.

description: It's just the same as Pancho Villa except it has a shorter line. The same great deals and food. Thank goodness because I absolutely love those salsas.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Wow, I am amazed by how consistent this place is with Pancho Villa up the street. I believe they are owned by the same people. Same happy hour, $1 tacos, $2 beers, great special!

Unfortunately, the food is just okay. I've been here a couple of times now and have sampled pretty much all of the meats. The spicy chicken is like a boiled chicken in an orange-colored sauce that is actually really delicious. I normally am not a fan of this type of thing, but it turns out pretty well. The pollo asado was pretty good too, but was under-seasoned on my second visit. Otherwise though, not too dry, pretty good flavor. 

The carne asada was really bad in my opinion. both of my brothers said it was their faves, but they are somewhat less experienced in these sorts of things than myself. That being said, for people that are not looking for serious authentic carne asada flavor and just want a decent steak taco, it is probably pretty good. I thought the flavor was a little off putting, but I could be wrong, it has happened before. The al pastor on the other hand was unarguably flavorless. It looked so good! I felt sheepish (that's right, sheepish) because I always tout this as my standby, can't-go-wrong taco shop meat, but they managed to make it look amazing, but without any flavor. That takes serious skizillz! We were all unanimous in our displeasure with that one. 

The carnitas, on the other hand, were fantastic! I was speechless. With the possible exception of carne asada, this is the most difficult meat for a taco shop to do correctly. They nailed it. It was tender, flavorful, and mildly smokey, but they also roasted it just crispy enough. It was not that inedible deep fried crap that some places serve and not that flavorless mushy mess that other places try to pass off. Very, very good. 

My sister liked the tofu taco. I tried the fish taco, which was good for what it is, but it is definitely not baja style (read: not fried, no white sauce, no cabbage, etc.). Tasty though. My mom also liked the veggie burrito, but did admit that it was pretty bland by itself and needed lots of salsa. Which creates a fortunate segue into talking about their phenomenal salsa bar. Lots of varieties and recipes from frescas to spicy, habanero? style, etc. 

The beer is cheep at happy hour, the tacos are almost free and there are some decent meats. Definitely worth a try, especially if you are in the area and need a taco fix.
author: Miguel V.

description: Looking for a vegan spot on mission? Tofu on your burrito or taco sounds good? Delicious!!! Very generous portions. The store is clean and the servers are very friendly.
author: Katie K.

description: This was not real Mexican fare. This was American cold burritos. I was extremely disappointed. The only reason for 1 star was for their salsa bar. Also, when cleaning tables, please tell your staff not to use and re-use dirty towels, it kind of defeats the purpose.
author: Manu M.

description:
WARNING!!! PEANUT ALLERGENS BEWARE!!!


Unbeknownst to the staff, my dinner the other night was tainted with peanuts. This happens to me all the time, as I can go through anaphylactic shock with even the tiniest bit of peanuts, I've become very sensitive to the smell, and absolutely sensitive to when it's in my food, even by accident.

I don't think it's the fault of the staff (who claimed they don't EVER cook with peanuts) but I do feel that I wish the owner had been there. Whenever I speak about my peanut allergies to other managers it isn't just for me, it's also for future customers. Children and babies especially, do no have the tolerance I have developed over the years. Peanut allergies are considered the most severe food allergies, because their consequences can lead to death.

Otherwise, the food is great, the place is clean. I just wish I could've finished my dinner.

I hope someone can take better care of their food in the future and avoid accidental peanut contamination. But, in the meantime, I urge other people with severe peanut allergies, to steer clear of this place.
author: Maji H.

description:
This might be the worst burrito I have ever had in San Francisco.  It also might be the most expensive one. 

I knew I was going to be unhappy when I saw tofu on the menu. 

Why is this place still in business?
author: Charlie S.

description:
Love how their menu says: No MSG, No preservatives, No Bull. 

Had the Shrimp Super Nachos, which were huge. Had to take half home. I really like how they melt the shredded cheese and hide all the shrimp because you continuously are pleasantly surprised when you keep finding them..plus they are super tasty. Fresh guac, sour cream, lettuce, tomato, salsa..mmm.

Bit pricey, but I appreciate the quality of the veggies. Sometimes I'd find dried up radishes at other Mexican spots..Not Here..
author: Mary C.

description: My family and I have been coming to El Toro since the late 80s.  While I have become a pescatarian in the last five years, this is the one place that might convert me to my carnivore days as I did love those carne asada burritos.   But I'm sticking to fish!  They have great fish and shrimp options, and I love their guacamole.  The team preparing your meal are really nice and generous with toppings.  And don't forget the chips at the end of the line!  El Toro has a decent salsa bar and fresh juices (my favorites are watermelon and cantaloupe).  I wish they served horchata, but you can never go wrong with a juice or beer.  Oh, and their restrooms are really clean.  Overall, it's a great place to put an end to a growling stomach!
author: Claire M.

description:
I LOVE this place. They make the best burritos in the Mission that I have had thus far. The girls at the counter are a bit unfriendly, but great food! 

I'm a fan!
author: Aneliese R.

description:
Sadsies. This place used to be my favorite place to grab a burrito. The ingredients were flavorful and the super burritos were huge! I could barely finish it. 

What happened? The burritos are smaller and the prices went way up! The burrito is still tasty, but it looks more like a taquito. 

The flavors are still good, but not worth 8.50. Especially not for that portion size.
author: Siao W.

description:
Lo Mejor!!!!

We've been coming to El Toro for over 15 years, and this place is hands down THE BEST.
Try the steak + prawn burrito and you'll get a preview of what heaven should look or at least taste like.

Unfortunately we had to leave SF for Portland a few years ago and during a recent visit to "the homeland" I had to stop by and get two giant super burritos to make the trek back to Portland. Otherwise, my other half would have refused me entry into the house.
THAT'S how good El Toro is!
He inhaled his burrito FOR BREAKFAST (while I was still locked in the car....kidding!)
Anyway - wash it all down with a fresh Sandia or Horchata and read through all the negative reviews laughing.
El Toro is an icon in the old Mission.  
The kid who gave it a one star review because her boyfriend's taco shrinkage....what can you do..... *shrug*


PS - I haven't even started my homage to their original salsa verde....
author: Habibti D.

description:
One of my Favorite Places to eat in the city!!

I've been eating here since I was little with my parents and now with my hubby when we make the trip to the city. The food is amaze balls and authentic, I always order the "Taco Dinner" plate with Carne Asada. 
Which is a lot of food..especially if your in elementary school eating it but Ive never not finished it. I always had a huge appetite I guess.

Its a walk up and order down the line kind of service, pick your meat, beans, rice, etc.... Your able to pass people in line ordering too if your server is quick at getting your things together :) 

Their Flautas are the best ive ever had in my life! 
Im totally addicted to them, their soo yummy! I always order as extra :)

Parking can be a pain in the ass, so be prepared to pay for parking and walk if you have to, but its always worth it....
author: Jenn S.

description:
The salsa bar.  Sweet Jesus in the Crib is it amazing or what?  
I swear I am risking ebola, e-coli and seven different avian flus dipping in there but I can't keep away.  I just can't keep freakin away.  I just want to ask for one of those extra-wide boba ball straws and start snorting the sh1t up my nose it's that good.

The hangover buster (for me anyhow):
   - Horchata
   - Super Veggie Burrito
   - And enough salsa to rip a gut wall
author: Mark J.

description:
The food here is pretty delicious. However, the staff seemed a bit confused with my friend's order, and then was confused with mine. Our orders were simple. She wanted the super burrito, but instead of meat she wanted extra beans. I wanted vegetarian tacos with beans and guacamole. How confusing is this really?

Other than that, I was pretty impressed. My plate came with SO much food. Probably enough to feed 3 people to be honest. You can bet that I ate all of it.

Great place to come for an inexpensive, fast Mexican meal. Yum!
author: Ashley D.

description:
First let start by saying..... Wow.... Yum 
Excellent burritos , wonderful staff especially young woman with a very friendly smile ( karla) she is awesome 
Very fast staff and really good steak burritos and the quezadillas are to die for
author: Alejandro C.

description: My boyfriend and I ate here the other day. My boyfriend who is a chef himself said the food was very fresh and he loved it. I was like "it's okay..." My boyfriend told me the burritos there are awesome. Not sure why we didn't get one, but next time we go, I'll definitely get one.
author: Christina D.

description:
El Toro celebrates a wonderful thing called "Taco Happy Hour."

If you come here between 3pm and 5pm during the week, you'll pay a dollar per taco and $2 per beer.  For you English majors, that means for $20 you can walk out with a taco and nine beers.
author: Ryan P.

description:
Pretty freaking good super tacos with no fuss order process and the ever faithfully present Negro Modelo. 

No complaints and got to Oakland Airport on time.
author: Alita M.

description:
One of my favorite late night spots!!

The Mission disstrict is a great place to have some fun.  And the topper of a good night is a late night burrito that will save your life!!

And El Toro is yoru medicine!!  Nice and quick so you're not waiting around forever to get your food.

Bottom line is it is just a good Mission Style Burrito!
author: Reggie A.

description: The food, service, atmosphere and vibe are all top notch. I love this spot. I have only had their burritos and nachos, but am going to try something new next time.
author: Jen P.

description: El Toro does a very serviceable and dependable super veggie burrito. Their service and cleanliness standards appear to be a cut above other taquerias in the area (they have a perfect 100 hygiene score too I noticed!). The fresh juices are a good deal and always available. Tasty, simple food.
author: Paul R.

description:
Between 3pm-5pm is Taco Happy Hour.

$1 tacos - including vegetarian and vegan friendly tacos which have an option of tofu marinated in a tasty sauce

$2 beer - including negra modelo

Fast-food ambiance, but whatever. $1 tasty tacos. Sweet.
author: Kimberley D.

description:
I'm pretty sure this place is owned by the same big truck, 4 wheel driving owner of Pancho Villa.  So it's the same food, except it's less crowded, and cleaner!  Bonus!

I usually come here a couple of times a week.  I love the carnitas, chicken asado, carne asada and al pastor ANTYHING, tacos burritos, quesadillas.

The tacos are my fav, and so are there super nachos and quesadilla suiza.

They also have really good/fresh salsas and chips.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Get a steak taco. Best $3 I've spent in years. Free chips to scoop up the meat, beans and salsa that spill off your overflowing taco. So good!
author: Lenny V.

description: Clean, fresh, and they even have an online menu. El Farolito still hits the greasy burrito / quesadilla craving, but I got a soft spot for this place, their 3 taco deal and watermelon aqua fresca. $1.50 happy hour tacos seem like a steal at first until you realize that they put 1/2 as much meat on them as the 3.00 tacos, but hey, still a consistently tasty spot to hit up when I lived on 17th. Never a long wait either.
author: James G.

description: This place loved up to the hype. I had the prawn taco for $3.50 and made it a super taco for $1 more - the food is fresh and delicious. Definitely a must try!
author: Cary V.

description:
My wife and I have been coming here since we lived in The City (back in the 80's); we've never been disappointed with the food or service and we always stop by whenever we're in the city.  The only drawback lately are the musicians who come in and ask for donations.  They all seem like good guys and I'm sure a lot of folks will find them charming.  

It's just not my thing to be serenaded.  If they had just played their music outside the front door I would've enjoyed my delicious meal a whole lot more.
author: Barry S.

description:
If I could give this place no stars, I would.

Small portions, dry, flavorless food, little variety, not authentic.

You're better off walking a few more blocks to Tacqueria Cancun on Mission/19th.

I would never return here. If I wanted to pay a lot for cheap knockoff Chipotle, I'd go to Zapata.

[Note: this was written by my boyfriend, who doesn't want / have a Yelp account. I didn't actually try the food, but it did look like a cheap Zapata knock-off to me...]
author: Michael F.

description: Excellent food, many different varieties of salsa at the salsa bar, and great service. I also noticed that this place is cleaner than other taquerias I've been to. I've only been here once so far (I got a burrito, which was super flavorful), but it left a great first impression. El Toro might turn out to be my favorite taqueria in the Mission District.
author: Brandon D.

description:
This place is delicious!  

I've been going here for about 8 to 9 years and just love the food and the service.  Very fast and always fresh.
author: Jeff M.

description:
THUMBS UP!

My friends introduced me to this place and I have to say, it was the best introduction ever! Great food, fresh-tasting, excellent service and hits the spot.
author: Julio L.

description:
Not bad, basically a smaller version of Pancho Villa on 16th.  I suspect its the same owners too.

I docked them a star for using crappy hotdog-style buns for the Tortas.
author: joe b.

description: First off, I've never been to a taqueria that has advertised a "chicken asado" burrito.  It's like they're trying to appeal to the English speaking crowd by letting them know it's really a chicken burrito while trying to keep it authentic with the asado wording.  I was not overly impressed with my $8 chicken asado burrito.  Very average in my honest opinion.  Should have pounced on that Scoutmob deal when it was available.
author: Albie F.

description:
Place is yum. 

Pros: decent vegetarian options, food is flavorful, and they've got an awesome salsa bar. 

Cons: the line is kinda Chipotle-ish, which isn't bad, just a little weird. Feels fast foody. 

4 stars bc they'll never be as good as Cancun.
author: Allison S.

description: My favorite place to go for fish tacos! Burritos are good, but I have another favorite place for burritos. The happy hour specials are really good deals!
author: Chester Q.

description:
¡Cuidado! This place is muy pelligrosso! 

I basically can't eat carne asada burritos now, because I no longer live in San Francisco. El Toro spoiled me forever, for their carne asada special burrito, with a Negro Modelo or two, and the green guac/salsa on the tables: it is perfection.

It all started in the late 80s, when I was working on a city council race in Oakland, and the campaign manager, an Argentine no less, brought me to El Toro after one long brutal day on the campaign trail. 

And then I somehow fell into Irish politics, which tends to take place in the myriad Irish bars in SF...and I would end up every night trying to soak up the Guinness at El Toro. (Here's where you must apply caution...I put on 60 lbs around this time, pretty much just from beer and burritos.)

Since then, I have been searching the country for a carne asada burrito that can equal El Toro's...and so far, none can. (Even Chipotle, which seems to have made a close study of the there-for-all-too-see El Toro system--theirs falls short, too.)

So ignore those neophytes who can't see The One True Burrito Mecca even though they are standing right in it! I always turn to face 17th & Valencia from wherever I am standing, disappointed once again with some burrito pretender, and say to myself this promise: 'Next year in El Toro!'
author: Pear U.

description: Great Mexican food. Multiple choices for beans. Big selection of salsas. Vegetarian Friendly. Cheap. Fast. Delicious.
author: Waves P.

description:
Yummy Mexican food! This is just what I needed after coming back from London, Paris and Amsterdam. Though I ate pretty well overseas (not in London but that's another story), there's nothing like coming back home to what you know. And since I live in the Mission, this is what I've been craving! 

I got a huge shrimp burrito that was packed with meat. It was so delicious! It's always nice to have a fresh salsa bar and free chips that come with the meal. I also got a "la burrita" chicken bowl which is the same concept as a Chipotle burrito bowl but smaller. If you are a light eater or need a mini meal, this would be perfect. 

What really makes this place special for me is the sweets! They have a bunch of fruit juices and three desserts: flan, churros, and my favorite kind of cookie: ALFAJORS! If you like shortbread and caramel you'll be a fan. Order that and a refreshing watermelon juice to wash everything down.

It's good to be home!
author: Julia T.

description:
Much like its big sister Pahco Villa down the road: Not the most fabulous place, but they're:
- always open
- totally decent
- kind of spendy
- have a fabulous wide range

And when your crazy cousins/parents/uncles/niecephews come into town and you think they'll be too escairt by a real taqueria... this one's a starter.

But overpriced. Decent. But overpriced. And they manage to deliver an excellent customer experience overall, what with that nice salsa bar and all that.
author: Glen M.

description: Went on June 16 to El Toro with a friend. I had a large carnitas taco he had a super sized burrito. The carnitas were moist and tender. Corn tortilla on my taco was fresh. The guacamole had a nice zip of cilantro, the spicy salsa had some heat without being a flamethrower and refried beans were creamy not greasy. Good price to value to taste. Bright and clean. My friend who likes VERY large portions was satisfied with the amount of his food. Would definitely stop by again. I think it helps to know a few words in Spanish to clarify to the food preparers.
author: Armando H.

description:
So I've decided to stop going here altogether, which kinda sucks since I do enjoy the food. When the service deficit starts to impede upon your experience, it's time to pull the plug.

Normally, I'm not a name dropper, but this time I'm gonna make an exception. Why? Because "Sandra" was the most miserable little nugget I've ever encountered. Not only was she blatantly rude, but she didn't listen at all and glared at me while I was ordering. I'm a totally civilized patron (who tips generously) and I'm not super picky, so it was completely unprovoked.

Sweetheart, if life is that bad for you, maybe you should take a break. Taquerias are a dime-a-dozen in the Mission. I'll find another & make sure everyone I know avoids this crap trap until there's an attitude overhaul.
author: Matthew H.

description: I've tried at least a dozen of different Mexican restaurants in Bay Area, and this one is as good as it gets. I've never tried better tacos than there. All the ingredients were supper fresh and cooked properly. Place is also ultra cheap, you probably won't spend more than $10-$12 per person. Definitely try their tacos and aguas frescas. They also have a huge salsa bar (12 different salsas I think)
author: Igor P.

description: I'm leaving a 2 star rating because of the customer service. My husband and I were visiting SF from Chicago and wanted some cheap Mexican food (my husband is Mexican so he is a pretty good judge of Mexican food). When we arrived, it was 10 minutes to 3PM and we saw on this site that they have a happy hour from 3-5pm with $1.50 tacos, so to buy time we were asking the difference between the $1.50 tacos and the regular prices ones. The lady said that the happy hour tacos come with less meat and smaller tortillas. So I ordered 3 regular tacos and my husband ordered 3 happy hour tacos. There was absolutely NO difference and she still charged me $7 for three tacos that should have been $4.50. The food is ok...not anything fabulous, and I've had WAY better agua fresca. The staff did not go out of their way to help us or make us feel welcome. We won't be going back!
author: AJ G.

description:
I had to work late tonight, and lord knows there's no decent food at this hour in SOMA, so I took a break and drove over to Valencia and parked, and walked around to assess my options.

I decided I was in the mood for a burrito, so I fired up yelp on my Treo.

Though Pancho Villa gets rave reviews, I had it once, and it sucked.  Expensive too.  Plus, I get whistled at walking past Esta Noche, so I decided I'd try a new place.  

I remembered my sister mentioning that her favorite taqueria was on Valencia and just said "TAQUERIA" in big letters.  So, I walked over to El Toro.

Though El Toro averages 4 stars, reviewers noted that it's the same food as Pancho Villa.  Hmm.  OK, maybe they had an off night last time, so let's be adventurous.  One Pastor please, super, refried, spicy.  Dos Equis Amber, and one of the wedding cookies.

Enter the first flavorless burrito I've had in SF.  For the first 8 bites (yes, I counted) I was convinced it was a veggie burrito, except I had watched her make it, so I knew there was some meat in there somewhere.  There was no flavor, no zest, nada.  It might as well have been a bowl of Quaker Oats.

Their salsa was lame, the chips were stale, and my beer was warm.  The cookie was greasy, tasted weird, and was on the stale side too.  Could anything redeem this meal?

Nope.  Insult was added to injury when the dude decided that 10 minutes to 10 would be a good time to hose down the counters, while around 8 tables worth of customers were still eating.

L-A-M-E.  Why food this bad exists in an area like this is beyond me.
author: dan s.

description: The carnitas tacos are totally delicious and pretty great deal. You get a good sized taco and an order of chips with four different kinds of house made salsa for $3.50. What do you really have to complain about?
author: Michael A.

description:
One sunny day walking down Valencia, my boyfriend and I had a nacho crave and we walked in and ate some nachos.

The place was semi-full, and there was no line. Everything seemed fresh and they put a lot of toppings. It was yummy.
author: Sophia G.

description:
My friend and I found ourselves in the Mission today. We asked a passerby where the good shopping was and he told us more about the area; what was in which direction, etc. He offered a fabulous tip: "go to El Toro at 3PM and get tacos for $1. each." So after drifting in and out of stores, we followed his lead. El Toro delivered. We each had 2 pork tacos and were completely satisfied for $4 total. The bigger regular tacos looked great too. It has joined the ranks of my "must stop when in the neighborhood" places. 

Here is an update during from 11/11: I was in the hood and was psyched to go there again. I had a pork taco and the meat was way over-salted and seemed reheated for the 4th time and tough. I did not leave satisfied. Also, while I was first in line, the counter order taker waited on the person behind me instead of me. I'm not in a hurry to return.
author: Barbara S.

description:
This is my go-to taqueria because the food is good, reasonably priced, and it's closer to me than my real favorite, La Taqueria.

I usually alternate between the chicken and al pastor burritos.  The salsas and guac are tasty.  They GIVE you (for free) a generous helping of tasty chips with your food, and their salsas compliment them perfectly.  The place is sparkling clean, which is unusual for a Mission taqueria.  

My secret:  the burritos are huge, too much for any mortal to eat, so I order the "baby burrito", which is smaller, cheaper and the perfect size for my meal.  I also ask them to halve the amount of rice they use; cuts down on carbs.

I'd like to give a big shout out to the ladies who make the burritos and take your money at the register.  They almost always have cheerful smiles on their faces, positive attitude, and always make me smile.  The cashiers get to know you after a while and getting that knowing smile is nice.

A great neighborhood joint.
author: Paul S.

description: Super Delicious. Fresh, Fast, Similar setup to Chipotle.
author: Claire A.

description: The burritos are so fat. Enough for two meals in a day if you are the average weight. The steak is f*ckin fire
author: Leary M.

description: Mexican food in the mission is plentiful and they are almost all good.  Pancho villa wins for variety and efficiency, however, El toro wins for their grilled veggies.  Yes, their grilled veggies are fantastic and go great with a burrito or taco.  It's a delicious combo of broccoli, carrots, bell pepper and maybe zucchini.  I wouldn't recommend for vegans and vegetarians as the veggies taste like its been grilled in animal fat.
author: Christian W.

description:
